page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO ALVA
page.content: The area covered by this section is situated in Central{Scotland,}7 miles east of Stirling and approximatly 40 miles from both Edinburgh and Glasgow. Almost half the{landscape}in the section is taken up by the Ochil Hills which dominate this part of Scotland. They are made up of rock,gorse,and rough grazing,except for Wood Hill.About another third is arable land,which extends south from the foot of the Ochils.Parts of two{settlements come into the section. At the western end is the burgh of Alva and at the eastern end is Tillicoultry.Burns rising in the Ochils run through deep glens and eventually join the River Devon,a tributary of the{River Forth.}
